verses.devanagari:
तपस्स्वाध्यायनिरतं तपस्वी वाग्विदां वरम् ।
नारदं परिपप्रच्छ वाल्मीकिर्मुनिपुङ्गवम् ॥
verses.iast:
tapaḥsvādhyāyanirataṁ tapasvī vāgvidāṁ varam |
nāradaṁ paripapraccha vālmīkirmunipuṅgavam ||
verses.translation: The ascetic Vālmīki, devoted to austerity and study and foremost among eloquent sages, asked Nārada.

verses.devanagari:
कोन्वस्मिन्साम्प्रतं लोके गुणवान्कश्च वीर्यवान् ।
धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च सत्यवाक्यो दृढव्रतः ॥
verses.iast:
ko nvasmin sāmprataṁ loke guṇavān kaś ca vīryavān |
dharmajñaś ca kṛtajñaś ca satyavākyaḥ dṛḍhavrataḥ ||
verses.translation: Who in this world today is truly virtuous and mighty, knowing dharma, grateful, truthful in speech, and firm in his vows?

verses.devanagari:
चारित्रेण च को युक्तस्सर्वभूतेषु को हितः ।
विद्वान्कः कस्समर्थश्च कश्चैकप्रियदर्शनः ॥
verses.iast:
cāritreṇa ca ko yuktaḥ sarvabhūteṣu ko hitaḥ |
vidvān kaḥ kaḥ samarthaś ca kaś caika-priyadarśanaḥ ||
verses.translation: Who is endowed with noble character, a benefactor of all beings, learned and capable, and singularly delightful to behold?

verses.devanagari:
आत्मवान्को जितक्रोधो द्युतिमान्कोऽनसूयकः ।
कस्य बिभ्यति देवाश्च जातरोषस्य संयुगे ॥
verses.iast:
ātmavān ko jitakrodho dyutimān ko ’nasūyakaḥ |
kasya bibhyati devāś ca jātaroṣasya saṁyuge ||
verses.translation: Who is self-mastered, who has conquered anger and shines with brilliance, free of envy—and at whose wrath even the gods fear in battle?

verses.devanagari:
एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं परं कौतूहलं हि मे ।
महर्षे त्वं समर्थोऽसि ज्ञातुमेवंविधं नरम् ॥
verses.iast:
etad icchāmy ahaṁ śrotuṁ paraṁ kautūhalaṁ hi me |
maharṣe tvaṁ samartho ’si jñātum evaṁvidhaṁ naram ||
verses.translation: I wish to hear of such a man; my curiosity is great. O great seer, you are capable of knowing and telling me of him.

verses.devanagari:
श्रुत्वा चैतत् त्रिलोकज्ञो वाल्मीकेर्नारदो वचः ।
श्रूयतामिति चामन्त्र्य प्रहृष्टो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
verses.iast:
śrutvā caitat trilokajño vālmīker nārado vacaḥ |
śrūyatām iti cāmantrya prahṛṣṭo vākyam abravīt ||
verses.translation: Hearing this, Nārada—the knower of the three worlds—gladly addressed Vālmīki: “Listen,” he said, and spoke these words.

verses.devanagari:
बहवो दुर्लभाश्चैव ये त्वया कीर्तिता गुणाः ।
मुने वक्ष्याम्यहं बुद्ध्वा तैर्युक्तः श्रूयतां नरः ॥
verses.iast:
bahavo durlabhāś caiva ye tvayā kīrtitā guṇāḥ |
mune vakṣyāmy ahaṁ buddhvā tair yuktaḥ śrūyatāṁ naraḥ ||
verses.translation: The virtues you list are many and rare. O sage, having considered, I shall tell of a man endowed with them—listen.

verses.devanagari:
इक्ष्वाकुवंशप्रभवो रामो नाम जनैश्श्रुतः ।
नियतात्मा महावीर्यो द्युतिमान्धृतिमान् वशी ॥
verses.iast:
ikṣvākuvaṁśa-prabhavo rāmo nāma janaiḥ śrutaḥ |
niyatātmā mahāvīryo dyutimān dhṛtimān vaśī ||
verses.translation: There is one known among men as Rāma, born of the Ikṣvāku line—self-mastered, of immense prowess, radiant, steadfast, and controlled.

verses.devanagari:
बुद्धिमान्नीतिमान्वाग्मी श्रीमान् शत्रुनिबर्हणः ।
विपुलांसो महाबाहुः कंबुग्रीवो महाहनुः ॥
verses.iast:
buddhimān nītimān vāgmī śrīmān śatrunibarhaṇaḥ |
vipulāṁso mahābāhuḥ kambugrīvo mahāhanuḥ ||
verses.translation: Intelligent, principled, eloquent, illustrious and a destroyer of foes—broad-shouldered, mighty-armed, conch-necked and strong-jawed.

verses.devanagari:
महोरस्को महेष्वासो गूढजत्रुररिन्दमः ।
आजानुबाहुस्सुशिराः सुललाटः सुविक्रमः ॥
verses.iast:
mahoraskaḥ maheṣvāsaḥ gūḍhajatrur arindamaḥ |
ājānubāhus suśirāḥ sulalāṭaḥ suvikramaḥ ||
verses.translation: Broad-chested, a great archer, with deep-set collarbones, arms reaching the knees, noble head and brow—valorous beyond compare.
